title: Poster, "Spirited", 2011
provenance: Jianping He new to Cooper Hewitt, August 2014
description: A single chinese character in black calligraphy. Fine black lines connect the ends of the characters, forming a three-dimensional shape.
justification: Jianping He was among&nbsp;forty Asian designers invited by the Taiwanese calligrapher Tong Yang-Tze to collaborate on a group of&nbsp;twenty-four works of&nbsp;calligraphy focusing on the subject of "imitating nature." The theme, which had long been a driving influence in the tradition of Chinese painting and calligraphy, also reminded He of a quote by Albert Einstein: "Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better." Working with Yang-Tze, He designed a poster that features a single calligraphic Chinese character. He built-up a network of thin lines that connect the different ends of the character’s lines, transforming the flat design into a shape with a&nbsp;three-dimensional appearance.&nbsp; The poster was designed for the Asian Culture and Arts Development Alliance.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Spirited", 2011. Screenprint on paper. Gift of Jianping He. 2014-23-5.
